Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight is a common fungal disease that affects potatoes and tomatoes. It is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani.
symptoms: Small, dark, circular spots on lower leaves.
Leaves may turn yellow and drop off.
actions: Ensure good air circulation around plants.
Apply fungicides as a preventive measure.
Remove and destroy infected plant debris after harvest.

Tomato_Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot is a disease caused by several species of Xanthomonas bacteria, affecting tomatoes and peppers.
symptoms: Small, water-soaked spots on leaves that later turn greasy and black.
Slightly raised, scabby spots on fruit.
Severe infections can cause leaves to yellow and fall.
actions: Avoid overhead watering; water at the base of the plant.

Tomato_healthy.description: The plant appears to be in good health.
symptoms: No visible signs of disease or stress.
actions: Continue standard care, including proper watering, sunlight, and nutrient management.
